item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Perusalocity add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Rita Mae Brown
item.description: "About all you can do in life is be who you are. Some people will love you for you. Most will love you for what you can do for them, and some won't like you at all." -- Rita Mae Brown

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Benjamin Disraeli
item.description: "There are three types of lies -- lies, damn lies, and statistics." -- Benjamin Disraeli

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "For most of history, Anonymous was a woman." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by William Faulkner
item.description: "You can't beat women anyhow and that if you are wise or dislike trouble and uproar you don't even try to." -- William Faulkner

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Education is the ability to listen to almost anything without losing your temper or your self-confidence." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Plutarch
item.description: "The mind is not a vessel to be filled, but a fire to be kindled." -- Plutarch

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Josh Billings
item.description: "A dog is the only thing on earth that loves you more than he loves himself." -- Josh Billings

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Woodrow Wilson
item.description: "If a dog will not come to you after having looked you in the face, you should go home and examine your conscience." -- Woodrow Wilson

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It is what you read when you don't have to that determines what you will be when you can't help it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Make it a rule never to give a child a book you would not read yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Charles W. Eliot
item.description: "Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers." -- Charles W. Eliot

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "We love the things we love for what they are." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Perusalocity add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi
